column1: #Text=As has been previously reported, NaCeO2 can be prepared\rby reducing CeO2 in the presence of liquid sodium [53â€“\r55].

#Text=Here, we synthesized polycrystalline samples of NaCeO2\rfrom a 1.1:1.0 molar ratio of Na (99.95% Alfa Aesar) and\rCeO2 (99.99% Alfa Aesar), respectively, in sealed 316 stainless\rsteel tubes, following a similar synthesis method previously\rreported for NaTiO2 [56].
#Text=Reagents were inserted into\rthe steel tubes in an argon-filled glove box with oxygen and\rwater content below 0.5 ppm, and the tube was sealed within\rthe glove box.
#Text=The capped steel tubes were then placed into\ra tube furnace under held under vacuum at 1000 \C for three\rdays and were subsequently opened in a glove box.
#Text=The resulting\rgreen NaCeO2 powder rapidly degrades when in contact\rwith air and moisture, and therefore it was handled solely\rin dry, inert environments.

#Text=Sample composition was verified\rvia x-ray diffraction measurements under Kapton film on a\rPanalytical Empyrean powder diffractometer with Cu-K radiation,\rand data were analyzed using the Rietveld method in\rthe Fullprof software suite [57].
